questions.question: What is Coronavirus named for?

choices.answer: The aura of plasma that surrounds the virus.
The crown-like spikes on the surface of the virus.
The city in which the virus was first discovered.
It's the last name of the person who discovered it.

questions.question: COVID - 19 is a 'novel coronavirus'.  What does that mean?

choices.answer: It is a disease from a book.
It is a disease that the president has.
It is a new disease that has not been seen before.

questions.question: Wearing a mask helps protect you and others from COVID-19?
What is the correct way to wear a mask to protect yourself and others from Coronavirus?

choices.answer: Your mask should cover your nose and mouth.
Your mask should cover your mouth, but not your nose.
Your mask should cover your chin but not your nose or mouth.
Your mask should only cover your eyes.

questions.question: How far should you be from someone to safely practice physical distancing?
It is recommended that you wash your hands for at least 40 seconds to prevent COVID-19 germs from spreading.
Which of the following are symptoms of COVID-19

choices.answer: A cough and chills or fever.
Difficulty breathing, and body and muscle pain.
Loss of taste or smell and sore throat.

questions.question: If you travel to a high risk state, how long are you required to self-quarantine if you have not had a negative test?

choices.answer: You do not have to quarantine.

questions.question: If you exhibit symptoms of COVID-19 you should still come to school.
You can get a face mask exemption card so you don't have to wear a face mask.
You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by injecting, swallowing or bathing in bleach, disinfectants, or rubbing alcohol.
How does someone catch COVID-19?

choices.answer: By little droplets from coughs or sneezes.
Through physical contact from another person.
By touching your face after touching objects touched by an infected person.

questions.question: Drinking lots of water helps flush COVID-19 out of your system.
If someone with COVID-19 is asymptomatic it means:

choices.answer: They only have symptoms but do not have COVID-19.
They had COVID-19 symptoms, got COVID-19, and have recovered.
They have COVID-19 but do not have symptoms.

questions.question: Can you safely reuse a disposable mask?

choices.answer: Yes, if you leave it in a clean, safe place for a few days to disinfect it.
Yes, you don't need to disinfect it.
Only if it hasn't changed colors.

questions.question: What causes COVID-19?
What does COVID-19 stand for?

choices.answer: Certification of Vaccination Identification by Artificial Intelligence
Corona Onset Virus is Disastrous in 2019

questions.question: There is no vaccine for COVID-19.
What is the average recovery time for the coronavirus disease?

choices.answer: 2 days for mild cases and 3-6 days for severe or critical cases.
12-24 hours for mild cases and 1 week for severe or critical cases.
Anyone who gets it should recover in a few days.
2 weeks for mild cases and 3-6 weeks for severe or critical cases.

questions.question: When was the first human coronavirus discovered?
